definition: to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]

sentences.english: In the code editor, create an event-handling method with the appropriate signature.
sentences.chinese: 在程式碼編輯器中，以適當的簽章建立事件處理方法。

sentences.english: H. one original equipment acceptance certificate signed and affixed by the end-user and the seller.
sentences.chinese: 由最終使用者和賣方簽章的設備驗收證書正本一份。

sentences.english: The last is the corresponding personnel signature, it can be checked.
sentences.chinese: 最後就是相應的人員開始簽章，就可以進行了託運。

sentences.english: How do I request a Multi-purpose code signing certificates?
sentences.chinese: 我如何申請多用途程式碼簽章憑證？

sentences.english: Departments directly under the signature by the person in charge will be thoroughly examined to do for the city in statement.
sentences.chinese: 市直各部門經負責人簽章後，將摸底表報市編辦審覈。

sentences.english: For reflection, properties and events are hide-by-name-and-signature.
sentences.chinese: 關於反映，屬性和事件是依名稱和簽章隱藏。

sentences.english: XIII . This Agreement shall be in effect after it is subscribed.
sentences.chinese: 本協議簽章後即可生效。

sentences.english: The legal system of electronic certificate plays an important role in the law of electronic signature.
sentences.chinese: 電子認證法律制度在電子簽章法中具有重要地位。

sentences.english: An efficient realization of the scheme is proposed in this thesis.
sentences.chinese: 在這論文中我們提出一個有效率的此種簽章系統。

definition: summary/to summarize/to collect (data, receipts etc)/to gather and report/also written 匯總|汇总
to verify accounting records/also written 對帳|对帐[dui4 zhang4]
